title: CrowdStrike, Splunk, Kroger: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: U.S. stock futures wavered ahead of a full slate of economic data as investors keep an eye on a potential exile for Alibaba and other Chinese stocks
body:
Here’s what we are watching as markets kick into gear Thursday.U.S. stock futures were barely changed Thursday after new data showed initial jobless claims fell to 712,000 last week, below the 780,000 mark economists had forecast. Read our full market wrap here.
Investors are also keeping a close eye on renewed talk in Congress for a Covid-19 relief bill and efforts to exile Chinese stocks from U.S. markets.
Mastercard , HP and Nvidia are meant to present at the Credit Suisse Technology Conference. DocuSign , Smith & Wesson and Ulta Beauty will update investors after the bell.U.S. jobless claims are due at 8:30 a.m. ET. Two surveys of the health of the services sector—one from IHS Markit , and another from the Institute for Supply Management—will shed light on the health of the economy.
Shares in biotech firm Kinnate Biopharma are expected to start trading today.
—Shares in data-platform provider Splunk , which collects and analyzes data to help companies identify patterns and anomalies, sank more than 21% in off-hours trading, after earnings showed its losses widened in the third quarter on higher expenses and lower sales.
